descriptions.details1: Define sustainability and its implications for global energy
descriptions.details2: Describe the principles of energy generation, supply and demand from the range of available technology options
descriptions.details3: Evaluate the strengths and weaknesses of energy technology options for different locations

descriptions.details1: The physics of and how to model all aspects of a working solar cell: performance, efficiency limits and design rules.
descriptions.details2: Design concepts and fabrication processes of various photovoltaic (PV) technologies and applications.
descriptions.details3: How to evaluate components of a PV system: PV modules, inverters, DC-DC converters, batteries, charge controllers and cables.

descriptions.details1: Components of solar radiation, solar cells and standard solar spectrum characteristics;
descriptions.details2: Monitoring of air quality, meteorology and challenges in harsh climates;
descriptions.details3: Energy yield of PV modules and how to predict it under specific environmental conditions;

descriptions.details1: Learn how to efficiently convert biobased feedstocks into desired products.
descriptions.details2: Understand how to identify suitable raw materials and create valuable new products.
descriptions.details3: Learn how to refine biomass without damaging its valuable components.
